    model package¶

    base.py¶

    This is the module that defines the base model.

    check_params(classes)[source]¶

    Checks the BaseModel parameters.

    Parameters:

    classes (dict[str, Callable]) – class list.

    class BaseModel(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

    Bases: Model

    Defines the base model.

    • You can customize train_step() and test_step() using .fit().

    • In eager mode, you can output calculation results using print() or logging in train_step(), test_step(), or .call() of class-form models.

    • In graph mode, you can output too. But you will need to implement a custom layer that tf.print() the input.

    Parameters:

    classes (dict[str, Callable]) – class list.

    update_metrics(data)[source]¶

    Updates metrics.

    Parameters:

    data (tuple[tf.Tensor]) – tuple of labels, preds, loss, and sample_weight.

    property metrics¶

    Returns list of metrics classes.

    This function is decorated by @override and @property.

    • When using .fit() or .evaluate(), Metrics must be run .reset_state() at the start of an epoch. By setting the return value of this method to a list of all metrics, it will automatically run .reset_state().

    Returns:

    list[Callable] – list of metrics classes.

    train_step(data)[source]¶

    Trains the model one step at a time.

    This function is decorated by @override.

    1. Output predictions. (forward propagation)

    2. Output losses.

    3. Output gradients and update model parameters. (back propagation)

    4. Update metrics.

    Parameters:

    data (tuple[tf.Tensor]) – tuple of inputs and labels (and weights for each input).

    Returns:

    dict[str, float] – all metrics results.

    test_step(data)[source]¶

    Validations the model one step at a time.

    This function is decorated by @override.

    1. Output predictions. (forward propagation)

    2. Output losses.

    3. Update metrics.

    Parameters:

    data (tuple[tf.Tensor]) – tuple of inputs and labels (and weights for each input).

    Returns:

    dict[str, float] – all metrics results.

    layer.py¶

    This is the module that sets up model layers.

    check_params(params, func)[source]¶

    Checks the SetupLayer parameters.

    Parameters:

    • params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

    • func (dict[str, Callable]) – Class variables whose values are available methods.

    class SetupLayer(params)[source]¶

    Bases: object

    Sets up the model layer.

    • If you want to use some other settings, implement it as a method of this class. If you implemented, set the name as the func key in __init__() and the method as the value.

    Parameters:

    params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

    setup()[source]¶

    Sets up model layers.

    Returns:

    list[Callable] – list of model layers.

    flatten()[source]¶

    Sets keras.layers.Flatten.

    Returns:

    Callable – model layer class.

    dense()[source]¶

    Sets keras.layers.Dense.

    Returns:

    Callable – keras.layers.Dense class.

    conv2d()[source]¶

    Sets keras.layers.Conv2D.

    Returns:

    Callable – model layer class.

    maxpool2d()[source]¶

    Sets keras.layers.MaxPool2D.

    Returns:

    Callable – model layer class.

    relu()[source]¶

    Sets keras.layers.ReLU.

    Returns:

    Callable – model layer class.

    This is the module that sets up model.

    class SetupModel(params)[source]¶

    Bases: object

    Sets up model.

    • If you want to use some other settings, implement it as a method of this class. If you implemented, set the name as the func key in __init__() and the method as the value.

    Parameters:

    params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

    setup()[source]¶

    Sets up model.

    Returns:

    Callable – model class.

    simple()[source]¶

    Sets lib.model.simple.SimpleModel.

    Returns:

    Callable – model class.

    simple.py¶

    This is the module that builds simple model.

    check_params(params)[source]¶

    Checks the SimpleModel parameters.

    Parameters:

    params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

    class SimpleModel(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

    Bases: BaseModel

    Builds the following simple model.

    • MLP (Multi Layer Perceptron)

    • CNN (Convolutional Neural Network)

    Parameters:

    params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

    Attention

    Since the structure of a class-based model is not defined until input is given, .summary() cannot be used. For the same reason, trained weights cannot be applied, so dummy data is input in __init__().

    call(x)[source]¶

    Outputs the model predictions.

    This method is decorated by @override.

    Parameters:

    x (tf.Tensor) – input.

    Returns:

    tf.Tensor – output.
